text: Kuruthipunal () is a Tamil novel written by Indira Parthasarathy. A revolutionary novel, it was based on the Kilvenmani massacre that took place in Thanjavur district in 1968. The novel won the Sahitya Akademi for its author in 1977. The novel inspired Kann Sivanthaal Mann Sivakkum, a 1983 Tamil film, which in turn won a National Award. The novel has been translated into multiple langues including English, Hindi, Bengali, Oriya, Gujarati and Malayalam. == References == Category:Indian novels adapted into films Category:Novels set in the 1960s Category:Novels set in India Category:Sahitya Akademi Award-winning works Category:Tamil novels Category:Novels set in Tamil Nadu
